properties.areaDesc: Kershaw, SC; Fairfield, SC; Lancaster, SC
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South
Carolina...

Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties


Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood...Newberry and Saluda
Counties

Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun...Lexington
and Richland Counties

Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun
and Richland Counties

North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County

Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield...Kershaw and
Lancaster Counties


.All area rivers have crested and are slowly falling. Additional
rain expected today and on Thursday will keep some rivers above
flood stage.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wateree River At Lake Wateree.
* until further notice...Or until the warning is cancelled.
* At  9 AM Tuesday the stage was 102.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 100.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall to a stage of 102.5 feet
by early this afternoon.
* At 103.0 feet...Home owners on low lying property have to move
belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat
launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water.
* At 102.5 feet...Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded.
* At 100.5 feet...Several yards and docks in low lying areas around
Lake Wateree begin to flood.
* At 100.4 feet...The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton
Creek become submerged.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The
water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to
play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to noaa weather radio...
local media or the internet for further statements and updated
forecasts.
